Package de.fourofakind.businesshotel.server.entities.bookings

Class Booking

java.lang.Object
de.fourofakind.businesshotel.server.entities.bookings.Booking
Direct Known Subclasses:
ConferenceRoomBooking, HotelRoomBooking
@Entity(name="booking")
public abstract class Booking
extends java.lang.Object

This is our main class - Every action that is made from an employee or customer will interact with this class. All information about the Bookingdetails and the Booking itself interacts with this class to. For Java1 only the Employee will be able to alter the information of a booking

    Booking​(java.lang.Integer roomNo, float pricing, java.lang.Integer empNo, java.util.Date startDate, java.util.Date endDate, java.lang.String specialWishes, java.lang.Integer customerID, Customer customer, Employee employee)
    The Booking class is an abstract class because it is the blueprint for the Conference- and the HotelroomBooking which are the different types of rooms.

  • Constructor Details

    • Booking

      public Booking​(java.lang.Integer roomNo, float pricing, java.lang.Integer empNo, java.util.Date startDate, java.util.Date endDate, java.lang.String specialWishes, java.lang.Integer customerID, Customer customer, Employee employee)

      The Booking class is an abstract class because it is the blueprint for the Conference- and the HotelroomBooking which are the different types of rooms. Maybe later there will be even other types of what you can make a booking of, in this case we will have to add a enum to BookingType and a class to this new Booking only.
